title: American_Top_40_1988_February_13th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. A few are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.

In this broadcast:

We have the first top 40 hit by a Christian heavy metal band.

One song in the countdown has been remade five times before. Including its original release, this is the seventh time it has been in the top 40.

The first male solo singer to ever have three number one hits from the same album is in this countdown with a fourth song debuting from that same album.

There are four acts in this countdown that have charted in three decades; the 60's, the 70's and the 80's.

One artist in the countdown holds the record for having the most top ten hits, eleven of them, without ever hitting number one.

One artist in the coundown "borrowed" two pieces of music from Rachmaninoff, and every time one of those songs plays, he pays. Casey gives the details.
